summary.para: Gets application-defined data from a DirectML device object. This method is thread-safe.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID that is associated with the data.

param.name: dataSize
param.para: A pointer to a variable that on input contains the size, in bytes, of the buffer that data points to, and on output contains the size, in bytes, of the amount of data that GetPrivateData retrieved.

param.name: data
param.para: A pointer to a memory block that receives the data from the device object if dataSize points to a value that specifies a buffer large enough to hold the data.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If the data returned is a pointer to an (or derived interface) that was previously set by , then that interface will have its reference count incremented before the private data is returned.

summary.para: Associates a name with the DirectML device object. This name is for use in debug diagnostics and tools. This method is thread-safe.

param.name: name
param.para: A NULL-terminated UNICODE string that contains the name to associate with the DirectML device object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets application-defined data to a DirectML device object, and associates that data with an application-defined GUID. This method is thread-safe.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID to associate with the data.

param.name: dataSize
param.para: The size in bytes of the data.

param.name: data
param.para: A pointer to a memory block that contains the data to be stored with this DirectML device object. If data is NULL, then dataSize must be 0, and any data that was previously associated with the GUID specified in guid will be destroyed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Associates an -derived interface with the DirectML device object, and associates that interface with an application-defined GUID. This method is thread-safe.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID to associate with the interface.

param.name: data
param.para: A pointer to the -derived interface to be associated with the device object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: An interface from which and inherit directly (and all other interfaces, indirectly). Consequently, it provides methods common to all DirectML interfaces, specifically methods to associate private data, and to annotate object names. The IDMLObject interface inherits from the interface.
